i'm jus starting to use ubunto so please excuse me for asking newbies question

With *nix, you don't really need to know where programs go.  They're all in your path.  So, (if you ddn't have an applicaion menu) you'd go to a terminal and type 'thunderbird' and it'd start.  (well, usually the name is pretty straightforward, sometimes you need to use tabcomplete to figure it out)
like bigcx2 said.  Sometimes the name isn't quite so simple, but it's easy to figure out.  But even then, it should be in your application menu currently.
Did you follow the instructions on that page?
You should upgrade to 6.06, since 5.10 will go out of support in a few weeks
Yes, you upgrade in place.  That link has instructions.  You need to upgrade from 5.04 to 5.10, then from 5.10 to 6.06
You don't want to.  5.04 isn't supported anymore.  Download a newer version.
